page.title: 06WHINNYHALL FARM - STOCK : 1
page.content:
{Whinnyhall Farm}is an example of a {mixed farm}from this area. The farm is about 70 hectares in size and includes the land which formerly belonged to Parknook Farm.
It is owned by Mr W. Quinn who has farmed the land at Whinnyhall since 1966 when he bought the land from the National Coal Board who had previously let the land to a tenant farmer. Before 1966, the farm operated as a dairy farm, but since then it has been run as a mixed farm.
{STOCK - Cattle}- 120 dairy replacement heifers are kept on the farm. Every year 40 calves are bought at Lanark and they are reared on the farm for 3 years, after which they are sold to English dealers as replacement stock for dairy herds.
